item.title: A New Divinity Game Is Likely That Mystery TGA ‘Demonic Statue’ Announcement
item.content:encoded:
• 0-20%: Unlikely - Lacks credible sources
  • 21-40%: Questionable - Some concerns remain
  • 41-60%: Plausible - Reasonable evidence
  • 61-80%: Probable - Strong evidence
  • 81-100%: Highly Likely - Multiple reliable sources

Website MP1st has discovered new Divinity trademarks registered today in Europe. Not only is it a strong suggestion that Larian Studios will unveil a new installment in the series very soon, likely in two days at The Game Awards 2025, but it also appears to solve the mystery of the demonic statue teased by Geoff Keighley and the TGA team via social media. The aforementioned trademarks include a few logos, such as the Divinity one above, and two more, such as the following design:

Well, that's what the demonic statue (which is physically located in the Mojave Desert) looks like at night:

A new Divinity game was always the safest bet once Larian Studios announced that it was not going forward with Baldur's Gate 4 despite the enormous success of the third installment. The developer would want to reap the profits of future games all on its own, so it would need to own the intellectual property of its next games. Other than a science fiction RTS title titled The L.E.D. Wars and released in 1997, though, Larian only ever made Divinity games. It was either another installment of their acclaimed cRPG franchise or a brand-new IP, and the latter would always carry a degree of risk. Besides, Original Sin 2 sold well and received almost as much acclaim from critics and fans as Baldur's Gate 3.

An announcement so early is certainly a bit of a surprise, though. Less than a year ago, Larian Studios CEO Swen Vincke said that their next project would be very big, but also added that it needed 'a lot more time' in the proverbial oven. Just a bit earlier, in October 2024, Vincke had dropped a hint that it would take 'another five years' before they could return to an award event and win more prizes after Baldur's Gate 3, which fans took to mean that the studio might target a launch in 2029.

That said, considering their track record, Larian revealed Baldur's Gate 3 in June 2019, more than four years before its final launch date of August 3, 2023. So, the timeline fits. An early access release appears to be very likely as well: all three of the studio's most recent games launched first on early access and then gradually made their way to version 1.0.

So, perhaps early access could launch in 2027, with a tentative late 2029 release window. That's mere speculation for now, though. We may learn more in just two days.

Follow Wccftech on Google to get more of our news coverage in your feeds.



https://wccftech.com/new-divinity-game-is-likely-that-mystery-tga-demonic-statue-announcement/
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Ex-Perfect Dark Reboot Leads Form New Studio at 2K
item.content:encoded:
The two former project leads for the now-canceled Perfect Dark reboot have set up a new studio under the auspices of publisher 2K, it's been revealed.

According to Jason Schreier over on Bluesky, former The Initiative studio head Darrell Gallagher and Perfect Dark director Brian Horton have started a new development company, and it'll be a subsidiary of 2K (itself a publishing label for parent company Take-Two).

Speaking to IGN, a 2K spokesperson said the company is "thrilled" to welcome Gallagher and Horton to its ranks, and that, while it doesn't have any additional information to share now, it looks forward to sharing more about the new studio "in the future".

In case you need a reminder, Xbox's Perfect Dark reboot was canceled earlier this year, and its developer The Initiative was shut down into the bargain.

The game's cancellation and the studio's shutdown were part of a larger wave of layoffs at Microsoft, with around 9,000 employees losing their jobs, including staffers at subsidiaries like Candy Crush Saga's King and Bethesda's parent ZeniMax.

Legendary studio Rare was also among the companies hit by the wave of layoffs, and the long-in-development Everwild was canceled as well, seemingly leaving Rare with no games currently in the works (although the studio is still supporting multiplayer pirate adventure Sea of Thieves).

Of course, the sweeping wave of Microsoft layoffs didn't stop Xbox reporting a revenue increase back in late July, and it also doesn't appear to have stopped the company seemingly expecting its studios to hit ridiculously high profit margins (which might explain some of the staff cuts).

Earlier this year, Schreier reported that Take-Two was close to saving Perfect Dark from its ignominious demise, but that the deal fell through; Gallagher and Horton's new studio under 2K makes a lot of sense when examined through that lens.

We'll have to wait and see what the two are cooking up with their new studio, and whether it'll bear any resemblance to Perfect Dark at all. Stay tuned for more.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph



https://techraptor.net/gaming/news/perfect-dark-reboot-leads-new-studio-2k
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: RPG Fans Pray Baldur’s Gate 3 Studio Is Using The Game Awards Hell Statue To Tease Divinity: Original Sin 3
item.content:encoded:
Geoff Keighley may not be opening a portal to hell after all. Roleplaying game fans have desperately linked The Game Awards’ hell statue to a new trademark application filed Tuesday and reported by games publication MP1ST. A law firm filed a European trademark application on Tuesday under the name Divinity, and the symbol in the accompanying stylized graphic certainly does look familiar.

Two other trademark applications, showing similar imagery, were filed alongside the Divinity one. One looks to be of a person tied up in a spiderweb, and the other has a striking similarity, again, to the symbol overlaid on the Game Awards statue. The trademark application for Divinity categorizes it under computer game programs and video game software, as well as books, clothing, board games, and other “entertainment services.” No other information is available in the application to link the trademark to either the Game Awards statue or to Divinity: Original Sin and Baldur’s Gate 3 developer Larian Studios.

Kotaku has reached out to Larian Studios for comment on the trademark application and its connection to the Game Awards statue. A Larian Studios representative did not mention Divinity: Original Sin 3, but said: “We are releasing Divinity: Original Sin 2 on Next Gen but weren’t going to announce it until a bit later, so please keep an eye out!”

Larian Studios announced in 2024 it’s working on two projects. All founder Swen Vincke would say, at the time, was that one is codenamed Excalibur. The studio is coming off of the massive success of Baldur’s Gate 3, released in 2023. But before Baldur’s Gate 3, Larian Studios was best known as the maker of the Divinity series, starting with 2002’s Divine Divinity and its 2004 sequel, Beyond Divinity. It’s published six different Divinity games, as well as expansion packs and enhanced editions of the games. The last Divinity game, Divinity: Original Sin 2, was released in 2017. Asked about Divinity: Original Sin 3 in 2024, Vincke wouldn’t say anything except that whatever the studio’s next game is was “different than what you think it is,” yet “still familiar.”

The Game Awards are just days away, so it’s unlikely that Larian Studios will say much about the trademark application or its potential link to the mysterious statue before the big show. But for many, that doesn’t matter: The trademark application and the accompanying logos appear to be more than enough to keep fans’ hope alive.



https://kotaku.com/divinity-original-sin-3-game-awards-statue-theory-2000651769
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Spirit Crossing adds PC version
item.content:encoded:
• PC

PC version published independently by Spry Fox.

Following news that Spry Fox will be spinning out of Netflix and become an independent studio again, the developer has announced a PC version of cozy massively multiplayer online game Spirit Crossing will launch via Steam in early 2026.

Spirit Crossing is currently in open alpha testing for iOS via App Store (TestFlight) and Android via Google Play. The mobile versions will remain published by Netflix, but the PC version will be published by Spry Fox.

Here is an overview of the game, via Spry Fox:

Spirit Crossing is a cozy massively multiplayer online game focused on the joy of shared experiences, creative expression, and connection with friends within a vast, beautiful world with ever-changing environments. The game invites players to relax and explore a fantastical landscape as they harvest, participate in fishing tournaments or simply enjoy a quiet sunrise with friends or by themselves.

As players join the game, they will be assigned to a Waystation—a unique, thriving community that players collectively build, decorate, and fortify through offerings and acts of kindness. Players can travel to other Waystations, and participate in co-op activities such as harvesting, dancing and mural painting, or simply enjoy the world at their own pace.

Spirit Crossing emphasizes social interaction through a unique friendship progression system which unlocks features over time, such as proximity chat, two-player emotes, instant teleportation, and gift-giving. Beyond construction and socializing, self-expression is encouraged and facilitated with a housing system letting players decorate their own spaces with their own creative vision, and extensive avatar customization options.

During exploration, they will encounter delightfully small square bears, mysterious and charming villagers and wandering spirits in need of help and safety. With patience and kindness they will start to slowly open up to the player, revealing their stories and even gifting items back.

Watch a new trailer below.

PC Announce Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/12/spirit-crossing-adds-pc-version

item.title: Cozy thrift shop management simulation game Thrifty Business announced for PC
item.content:encoded:
Sticky Business developer Spellgarden Games has announced Thrifty Business, a cozy thrift shop management simulation game coming to PC via Steam in 2026.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

There’s a brand new thrift store in town, and guess what? You’re in charge!

In Thrifty Business, you’ll set up and manage your very own 90s-inspired vintage thrift shop. Search through boxes filled with pre-loved gems and use them to create gorgeous displays. Unlock furniture, decorations, wallpaper & floors to create a beautiful community space that brings everybody together!

Adjust your layout and organize your shelves and racks to the finest detail. Group your wares by color, theme, purpose, or whatever you like. The more organized your store is, the more community points you’ll get to unlock new goodies!

Customize the furniture, wallpaper, flooring, and decor to make your store as welcoming and cozy as possible. As business grows, you might even need to expand into the adjacent rooms!

This is so much more than just a store. Listen to customer’s stories and try to fulfill their requests. You can also unlock and host hobbyist events, turning your business into a treasured third space for locals!

What Thrifty Business Has in Store for You

  • Laid-back management sim.
  • Colorful 90s-inspired graphics.
  • Over 500 different items to add to your shelves.
  • Precision placing so you can organize exactly how you want.
  • Customization options: furniture, decorations, wallpaper, and flooring.
  • A quirky and unique cast of customers.

What You Won’t Find on Our Shelves

  • Stressful min-maxing to get the best possible profit.
  • Setting item prices or haggling.
  • Impatient customers that leave your store in anger.

Watch the announcement trailer below.

Announce Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/12/cozy-thrift-shop-management-simulation-game-thrifty-business-announced-for-pc
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Final Fantasy VII Remake Almost Ruined Cloud’s Sword
item.content:encoded:
Final Fantasy VII‘s Cloud Strife has two defining characteristics: he suffers from repressed emotional trauma and carries a giant sword. Square Enix almost toyed with ruining one of those when it was originally planning to develop the current remake trilogy.

The Ex-Soldier’s iconic Buster Sword looks like a six-foot butcher’s knife. While fans love it, the RPG publisher was worried it might not look realistic enough for the real-world aesthetic its Unreal Engine homages to the classic PS1 game were chasing. Maybe what looked good with blocky polygons back in 1997 wouldn’t fly in a less cartoony overhaul.

“While making Remake, there was this aspect of the weight and how Cloud swings [the sword] around with one hand that sort of felt like it would weaken the sense of realism, you know?” director Naoki Hamaguchi recently recalled in an interview with YouTuber Julien Chièze, according to a translation by Shinra Archeology.

“So at the time, when we were making Remake, there was some discussion about whether we should give Cloud a more realistic version of the Buster Sword,” he continued. “But it was just too iconic, and if we’d made it just a regular old sword, players wouldn’t accept it…in the end we stayed faithful to the OG and a whole new generation of people fell in love with it, so I think it was the right call.”

It’s hard to know just how serious Hamaguchi is being or just how real the concerns and doubts raised in those original meetings were. Take away his Buster Sword and Cloud is just a spikey-haired emo kid slowly having a psychological break with reality. Much harder for all the fans to cosplay as during conventions.



https://kotaku.com/final-fantasy-7-cloud-buster-sword-remake-2000651766
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: The Game Awards Statue Mystery Might Have Been Solved
item.content:encoded:
According to a new report, it seems like the mystery of the Game Awards statue may have been solved. Furthermore, if true, it comes from a studio fresh off huge wins at the event.

Since last month, a weird statue in the middle of New Mexico has appeared out of nowhere. Both The Game Awards and Geoff Keighley hinted at its true nature, but fans have been going berserk figuring out what it means. From God of War and Diablo to Saros and The Elder Scrolls, guesses have been all over the place. Some theories had some real weight to them, though many were shut down by industry figures like Jason Schreier and Cory Barlog. However, a new trademark for a legendary RPG series has been spotted, with the designs matching the statue perfectly.

New Divinity Game Possibly Being Revealed at The Game Awards via Mystery Statue, New Report Details

The report comes from MP1st, who previously did pieces on Dead Rising and Contraband. In it, the outlet found trademarks for a new Divinity game, directed by Baldur’s Gate 3’s Larian Studios. From the looks of it, the logo and accompanying images look strikingly similar to those of the statue. The picture of the listings, as well as the statue for reference, can be found here.

It’s important to note that the connection has not been confirmed by Larian or The Game Awards, so take it with a grain of salt. In any case, a new Divinity is something many fans will be pumped about. The last release, Divinity: Original Sin 2, came out in 2017 for last-gen consoles. The acclaimed RPG series took players to a new medieval fantasy world with turn-based combat and an isometric perspective. While the logo and all do look new, it could be a remaster of sorts for newer consoles. Still, Larian Studios has been on a roll after the success of Baldur’s Gate 3, so, needless to say, if true, it’s one to keep a giant glowing eye on.

Do you think The Game Awards mystery statue is related to Divinity? Does it match up? Would you like to see a new entry from the franchise? Ever played it? Leave a comment below and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more on The Game Awards, check out the coverage on ex-The Last of Us director’s new game and the future of Tomb Raider. Make sure to subscribe to the weekly newsletter!

MOBILE APP

Real-time news, exclusive podcasts, push alerts, and a better reading experience.

Available on Android



https://insider-gaming.com/the-game-awards-statue-mystery-possibly-solved-report/

item.title: New Divinity logo and symbols trademarked, matching mystery The Game Awards 2025 statue
item.content:encoded:
New Divinity game announcement seemingly imminent.

Trademarks for a new Divinity logo and two symbols were filed in Europe on December 9. While the owner information is currently not disclosed, the listed representative is IHDE & Partner Rechtsanwalte, the same firm that handles Larian Studios‘ other trademarks in Europe.

One of the symbols accompanying the trademark matches the image of a mysterious statue The Game Awards creator Geoff Keighley began teasing on November 28 in anticipation for a reveal at The Game Awards 2025 on December 11. Here is the symbol and statue for comparison:

—Symbol

—Statue

And here is the other symbol:

The new evidence suggests that the statue may be teasing the announcement of a new Divinity game at The Game Awards 2025.

Further supporting this, a PlayStation 5 version of Divinity: Original Sin II – Definitive Edition was added to the PlayStation Network backend today, as spotted by Twitter user @PlayStationSize, just over one year after PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series versions were rated by Pan European Game Information. The new addition could suggest that Larian Studios may be planning to shadow-drop current-generation versions alongside a new game announcement.

Thanks, MP1st.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/12/new-divinity-logo-and-symbols-trademarked-matching-mystery-the-game-awards-2025-statue
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Arc Raiders Cold Snap Update: Start Date, New Map Condition, And Everything We Know So Far
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Arc Raiders has been the talk of the town in the multiplayer arena over the past two months, landing a nomination for Best Multiplayer Game at The Game Awards and becoming one of the most played games in recent weeks. As players prep for this month's upcoming Expedition--an optional wipe that resets much of their progress in exchange for in-game rewards--they'll also be treated to the fresh Cold Snap update. This new content includes an additional snow-based map condition, a premium Raider Deck, and another event to complete for goodies. Here's everything we know about it so far.

Cold Snap release date

Arc Raiders' Cold Snap update will release on December 16, 2025. While we don't know an exact launch time for this update yet, the previous North Line update launched at 1:30 AM PT / 4:30 AM ET, so it's safe to assume this one may also launch in the wee hours of the morning for US-based players.

The Cold Snap update falls just one day before the Expedition window opens, which will allow players to send their raider off and reset much of their in-game progress any time before December 22. This should give dedicated players at least a few days to see this fresh content on their current raider before sending them off and starting anew.

Snowfall map condition

The Cold Snap update will feature the new snowfall map condition. While we don't know everything this condition will entail, we do know that heavy snow will reduce visibility and muffle sound, which should force players to engage in close-quarters combat--or tuck tail and run in another direction. Choosing the latter, though, may open you up to ambushes, as players will leave footprints in the snow that allow other raiders to track you more easily.

As with other map conditions, snowfall will rotate across a few of the game's existing maps and almost certainly increase loot value as an incentive for visiting and exploring the hazards within. Embark hasn't specified which maps will receive this condition yet, but based on layouts and existing map condition rotations, our best guess is Buried City and Blue Gate.

Arc Raiders Review

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

More quests

As with the North Line update, the traders back in Speranza will have a few new quests for you to complete when Cold Snap releases. We don't know how many quests there will be yet, but we anticipate they'll require you to visit the Snowfall map condition to complete at least some of the requirements.

Once we've checked out the new quests, we'll be sure to add them to our full Arc Raiders quest list, where you can find guides on how to complete them.

Flickering Flames event

The Cold Snap update also includes an all-new event. Similar to North Line's Breaking New Ground update, players will be tasked with contributing resources or completing tasks during raids to work toward a series of rewards. These events function much like a mini-battle pass, requiring a meaningful time investment without asking too much of players who just want to dive in casually.

New Raider Deck

In addition to the Flickering Flames event, players will also have a new Raider Deck (seasonal battle pass) to complete for cosmetics and more. This one is expected to be a premium deck, meaning you'll likely need to purchase it with real money before you can access all its content. However, we assume that the game's existing Creds currency will be used to buy each item in-game after you've unlocked the premium access, but we'll certainly update you when we know for sure.

For more on this extraction shooter, check out our Arc Raiders guide hub.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/arc-raiders-cold-snap-update-start-date/1100-6536803/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: RAM price hikes: the latest on the global memory shortage
item.content:encoded:
Random access memory, or RAM, is in just about every piece of technology we use. But it’s also the technology that AI companies like OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, and Meta are using to power the servers in their massive data centers. Now, the world’s biggest memory makers — Samsung, SK Hynix, and Micron — are taking advantage of a surge in demand, shifting their resources away from consumer-focused products and toward more lucrative deals with AI companies.

The result is a severe shortage in RAM for consumer products, which is not only contributing to price hikes on the RAM kits used by PC builders but also for the manufacturers of a range of devices, including laptops, smartphones, gaming consoles, and a whole lot more. Some companies, like Raspberry Pi, have already raised the prices of their products as a result of the increase, while others anticipate price hikes coming soon.

Here’s all the latest news on the rising price of RAM.

  • RAM is ruining everything

    Image: Cath Virginia / The Verge, Getty Images

    Memory suppliers just blew a hole in the PC gaming industry – and they’re about to do the same to everything else. For weeks, PC enthusiasts have borne the brunt of skyrocketing memory prices, but the shockwaves will soon impact a wider range of products as suppliers pour resources into a far bigger and more lucrative endeavor: AI.

    The biggest names in the AI industry are buying up DRAM memory for their sprawling data centers, and memory makers are prioritizing their demands over everyone else’s. DRAM is embedded “in every part of our digital society today,” Jeff Janukowicz, research VP at IDC, tells The Verge. That’s everything from laptops to smartphones, gaming consoles, smart TVs, cars, and even small amounts in solid-state drives (SSDs). “There’s a lot at stake,” he says.

    Read Article >

  • Samsung memory is nearly as big as Samsung Galaxy.

    I knew Samsung made lots of money making chips, not just electronics. But Emma’s RAM report puts it in perspective: Last quarter, the company earned nearly twice as much from memory as from its entire TV and appliance business.

    Samsung’s mobile biz was still bigger than memory ($22.8B vs. $18.2B), but not by much!

  • Crucial is shutting down — because Micron wants to sell its RAM and SSDs to AI companies instead

  • DRAM it! Raspberry Pi raises prices

    Raspberry Pi is increasing the price of several single-board computers in an attempt to offset soaring memory costs. The updates are being applied immediately and affect Raspberry Pi 4 and Raspberry Pi 5, with prices increasing by $5 to $25 depending on the model and amount of RAM. The 16GB memory variants of the Compute Module 5 are also being raised by $20, now starting at $140.

    “The current pressure on memory prices, driven by competition from the AI infrastructure roll-out, is painful but ultimately temporary,” Raspberry Pi CEO Eben Upton said in the announcement. “We remain committed to driving down the cost of computing and look forward to unwinding these price increases once it abates.”

    Read Article >

  • These prebuilt PCs are about to cost more due to rising RAM prices

    Photo by Artur Widak/NurPhoto via Getty Images

    The skyrocketing price of RAM is trickling down to custom PC makers, including CyberPowerPC and Maingear. On Wednesday, CyberPowerPC announced that it plans to adjust the pricing across all of its systems on December 7th, as reported earlier by PCMag.

    “Recently, global memory (RAM) prices have surged by 500% and SSD prices have risen by 100%,” CyberPowerPC says in a statement posted on X. “This has had a direct impact on the cost of building gaming PCs since 10/1/25.”

    Read Article >

  • RAM prices are so out of control that stores are selling it like lobster

    Michael Crider’s headline at PCWorld today perfectly captures how ridiculous the PC memory shortage has become: stores like the San Francisco Bay Area’s Central Computers are beginning to sell RAM at market prices, like you’d pay for the catch-of-the-day at a seafood restaurant.

    “Costs are fluctuating daily as manufacturers and distributors adjust to limited supply and high demand,” reads a message posted in the store’s display case, as spotted by Steve Lin. “Because of this, we can’t display fixed prices at this time.”

    Read Article >



https://www.theverge.com/news/839353/pc-ram-shortage-pricing-spike-news
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Geoff Keighley Talks Game Awards: ‘Lots Of Games Get Sold’
item.content:encoded:
The Game Awards just keeps getting bigger and bigger. While viewers sometimes complain about the marathon runtime and nitpick every game announcement trailer they don’t care about, Geoff Keighley’s year-end showcase has become the closest thing we still have to an old-school E3 marketing extravaganza. In the face of annual criticism about not putting the focus exclusively on the awards part of the ceremony, the host recently explained why his show is as much about recognizing art as it is about revealing big game announcements.

“There are many different constituents that tune in,” Keighley told The Game Business (a newsletter he cofounded with author Chris Dring) in a new interview. “And it is a balancing act. You correctly pointed out that there’s the awards aspect of the show, there’s the announcement aspect, and yes, there are some people that would like to see the show be all awards. Some would like to see all announcements.”

He described a virtuous cycle in which more viewership means more attention for the games being celebrated, big and small, which can in turn lead to more sales for the companies or indie teams behind them.

“My view always is that the announcements create a very wide audience that tunes into the show,” he said. “And because of that, when we do give out these awards, they’re seen by a lot of people. Lots of games get sold out of The Game Awards. Balatro had a huge boost. So hopefully it’s a good thing for developers. But that careful balance is a hard thing to strike and we don’t always get it right.”

Balatro was already a big sensation in the gaming world by the time The Game Awards 2024 aired, but its prizes that night helped catapult it to even bigger success in the months that followed, aided in part by a popular mobile port. All of a sudden games that were big among a hardcore group are exposed to a much wider audience.

Even just getting nominated can help raise visibility in that way. Alinea Analytics’ Rhys Elliott recently shared the estimated sales boosts that the Game Awards’ Game of the Year contenders have received over the past few weeks. While the effect was biggest for frontrunner Clair Obscur: Expedition 33, the most nominated game in TGAs history, nominees like Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 were also projected to have sold an additional 100,000 copies during the period.

Elliott says holiday sales are also a big factor in that. That’s probably why any Game Awards winners cut their price directly after the event to take advantage of the brief spotlight.



https://kotaku.com/geoff-keighley-game-awards-sales-balatro-clair-obscur-2000651728
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: When is Xbox Wrapped 2025 Coming Out? Expected Release Date & How To Check Stats
item.content:encoded:
Everyone is obsessed with ‘wrapping up’ more than just presents now as the Holiday season approaches. Xbox Wrapped 2025 is the best way to see how much time you’ve spent on your Xbox, what you’ve done on it, and accessing Xbox Wrapped is nice and easy.

The Xbox brand probably hasn’t had the hottest 2025, and the whole Game Pass price increase probably wasn’t the best of news. Despite these setbacks, there’s still a more than healthy player base on Xbox, and this is why Xbox Wrapped’s Year in Review could unearth some fascinating stats about your playtime.

Xbox Year in Review 2025 Expected Release Date

You should expect the Xbox Year in Review 2025 to arrive during the week of December 8, as this lines up with the last couple of editions of Xbox Wrapped.

Unlike other ‘Wrapped’ round-ups, the biggest consistency about Xbox’s Year in Review is the inconsistency. Looking back at previous releases, you can see that the Xbox Year in Review 2023 was Tuesday, December 12, and last year it was Wednesday, December 4.

You could guesstimate that it’ll be Wednesday, December 10, for the 2025 edition of the round-up. If it’s not the first week of December, then it has to be the second. We’ve already passed Tuesday, leaving a reasonable assumption of Wednesday, December 10.

Note: Insider Gaming is not claiming this is the date, but is assuming a logical conclusion. Stay tuned and keep checking back for updates.

How To Check Xbox Wrapped 2025 Stats

Once the official Xbox Wrapped 2025 notice is up, there should be an easy-to-access link where you sign in and claim your full Xbox Year in Review 2025 analysis.

This is based on the last couple of years, but it’s hard to imagine the process changing too much. Here’s how you potentially check your Xbox stats in 2025:

  1. Go to the Xbox Year in Review site.
  2. Log in to your Xbox account.
  3. This should automatically trigger your custom Xbox Wrapped journey.
  4. You can read and share details of your Xbox gaming in 2025.

You only have a limited time to check the review once it’s live. Make sure you do so, and take a screenshot or share the link to keep the stats as memories or future comparisons!

Share your results once the Xbox Year in Review 2025 is live. Apart from social media, you’re encouraged to head on over to the Insider Gaming Official Discord Server to discuss your stats with other Xbox users.

Insider Gaming also has full guides for Spotify Wrapped 2025, PlayStation Wrapped 2025, and Fortnite Wrapped 2025.

MOBILE APP

Level Up Your Gaming News

Available on Android

item.title: Former The Last of Us Director’s New Game Being Revealed at The Game Awards
item.content:encoded:
Bruce Straley’s studio, Wildflower Interactive, will be revealing its debut game at The Game Awards. Straley’s resume includes creating The Last of Us and directing Uncharted 2: Among Thieves and A Thief’s End for Naughty Dog.

The Game Awards are no strangers to The Last of Us. With the Naughty Dog IP winning multiple awards, including Game of the Year in 2020 for Part 2, it’s not surprising to see why. Last year, Naughty Dog even revealed its next project, Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet, at the end of the show. However, one of The Last of Us’ co-creators, Bruce Straley, wasn’t there, having left the company in 2017. He started Wildflower Interactive in 2021, an indie studio, but didn’t give more information than that. Now, fans can expect to see what the studio has been working on come December 11th.

New Game from Wildflower Interactive, Run by The Last of Us’ Bruce Straley, To Premiere at The Game Awards 2025

In a post on Twitter, Game Awards host Geoff Keighley announced that the debut title from Wildflower Interactive will be revealed at the show. The video, only 30 seconds long, shows off the game’s cel-shaded style and a neat wilderness setting. In the back, some dialogue can be heard, including a bear-like roar and some reassurance. No details, like the title or release, have been revealed, though it’s likely to appear during the show on December 11th.

Interestingly enough, Bruce’s co-director on The Last of Us, Neil Druckmann, will likely be in attendance. The TV adaptation of The Last of Us’s second season is nominated for Best Adaptation, in which Neil helped direct. Bruce’s legacy at Naughty Dog goes beyond The Last of Us, as he directed Uncharted 2: Among Thieves and A Thief’s End, which many claim to be the best in the series. Either way, an ambitious new project with a talented director at the helm is always something to look forward to.

What do you think about Wildflower Interactive’s new title? Excited to see what’s next for The Last of Us’ co-director at The Game Awards? Leave a comment below and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more Naughty Dog, check out the coverage for Intergalactic’s release timing and Neil’s opinion on Clair Obscur: Expedition 33. Make sure to subscribe to the weekly newsletter!

MOBILE APP

Level Up Your Gaming News

Real-time news, exclusive podcasts, push alerts, and a better reading experience.

Available on Android



https://insider-gaming.com/the-last-of-us-director-bruce-straley-wildflower-interactive-the-game-awards/

item.title: WoW Player Houses Are Now Officially Allowed To Fly
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

World of Warcraft players are pushing the game's new player-housing system to its limit, including defying the laws of gravity in a way Blizzard never intended. But rather than fix the ability to send houses skyward, Blizzard is instead embracing it.

When housing first arrived on December 2 as part of patch 11.2.7, it didn't take long for players to discover that, while the UI didn't show it, houses could actually be lifted off the ground using keybinds. The result was players making all kinds of airborne housing creations, including elaborate treehouses, airships, mechs, homes held up by kites, and everything in between.

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Now Playing: World of Warcraft - Housing 101 Overview Trailer

In a forum post, WoW community manager Randy Jordan (aka Kaivax) stated that instead of fixing the ability to elevate houses, Blizzard has with this week's scheduled maintenance actually made it easier by enabling proper controls to move houses upward.

That said, Blizzard does have some concerns. Since it never intended houses to be seen from underneath, the bottom of houses don't have proper textures, so players may want to hide or obscure that part of their home. Having a house in the sky also makes it difficult to reach the front door, so Blizzard advised building a ramp, a mount landing pad, or a jumping puzzle to make the front door accessible.

Being able to craft flying houses without fear of Blizzard bringing them back to the ground isn't the only good housing news. Blizzard also announced it increased the exterior-housing decor limit from 200 to 250 at housing level three.

"One of the biggest pieces of feedback we've gotten over the past few weeks was that the exterior decor budget felt too restrictive," Jordan said. "This was intentionally set to 200 to address performance concerns. Now that we have some data from live servers to look at, we're happy to conclude that we can increase this limit by 25%."

The increased exterior decor limit should result in even more fantastical creations--something that is hardly in short supply. Housing in Blizzard's MMORPG has brought plenty of suprises, including news that the game may soon allow for wedding ceremonies.

WoW player housing is currently in early access, with the full version of the feature set to arrive with the release of the game's Midnight expansion in March 2026. Buying a home in WoW and earning the "Weclome Home" achievement also grants players a number of cosmetics in other Blizzard games, including a Xal'atath-themed Overwatch 2 skin.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Sony Might Have Leaked Leon Kennedy In Resident Evil Requiem
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

While we're still a couple of months away from Resident Evil Requiem's release, it looks like there could be a surprise return awaiting fans. Before it was removed, the PlayStation Store revealed new cover art for the game that featured longtime Resident Evil protagonist Leon Kennedy. PlayStation 5 players noticed the art on the pre-download screen for owners of the standard (non-Deluxe) version of the game.

IGN later confirmed the art, which showed a stubbled and haggard-looking Leon hovering over Requiem's other main protagonist, Grace Ashcroft. Leon appeared similar to his Resident Evil 4 look, with his fur-lined leather jacket, albeit a bit more grizzled.

High-res image of the official Leon S. Kennedy version of the Resident Evil Requiem Playstation 5 icon that Sony accidentally leaked. pic.twitter.com/UpmAjU1LCp

— AestheticGamer aka Dusk Golem (@AestheticGamer1) December 9, 2025

Leon's inclusion in the game has been something that Capcom has vehemently denied, with even producer Masato Kumazawa denouncing alleged leaked images of Leon going around last month. "There has been a photo lately of Leon with an eyepatch, and just basically saying there's a DLC or a new costume for Leon--but just to make sure, these are all fake news," he told Stevivor in an interview, and added not to believe anything at face value.

So even though there was an attempt to keep Leon's involvement under wraps, Requiem still has plenty of surprises. Earlier this week, a GameStop listing mentioned another character who hasn't been officially revealed yet: Rosemary Winters, who fans think will have a smaller role. It also looks like if she shows up, she'll still have both of her eyes.

Resident Evil Requiem launches on February 27, 2026, for PS5, Xbox Series X|S, Switch 2, and PC.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Video: Skyrim Still Isn't 60fps On Switch 2, But Here's How It Fares Against Switch 1
item.content:encoded:
Must have been the wind

Bethesda surprised us all today with the announcement that The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim Anniversary Edition was heading to Switch 2 with a bunch of technical upgrades to boot. But with a game we've all seen this many times, would it really look all that different from the re-release we saw on Switch 1 back in 2022?

Well, wonder no longer, because Mr Alex Olney is here to reveal all! In the above video, we've got a side-by-side comparison of how Skyrim matches up on Switch 2 vs Switch 1, showcasing all the gameplay you could wish for.

As you'll see, there's certainly a bump on Switch 2, with the new release boasting "Enhanced resolution, improved load times, and optimised performance", but if you're expecting to see anything other than 'Skyrim, innit', think again.

We'll have our full thoughts on the latest version of Skyrim on Switch 2 soon enough. Until then, you can check out the S2 version either via a free upgrade (if you already own the Anniversary Edition on Switch 1), as a standalone purchase for £52.99, or via the base-game-to-anniversary-edition upgrade for £17.99.

What do you make of this comparison video? Let us know in the comments.

Jim came to Nintendo Life in 2022 and, despite his insistence that The Minish Cap is the best Zelda game and his unwavering love for the Star Wars prequels (yes, really), he has continued to write news and features on the site ever since.

  • Author Profile
  • Bluesky
  • Reply

item.title: Amazon Multiplayer Game Reportedly Got 10x Fewer Players Than It Was Hoping For
item.content:encoded:
King of Meat developer Glowmade will layoff “around a dozen people” early next year, according to a new report from Insider Gaming. These “voluntary redundancies” come just two months after the multiplayer party game hit Steam and after it reportedly failed to hit an ambitious 100,000 concurrent player target. King of Meat peaked at just 320 people on PC instead.

Over the past few days, several Glowmade developers posted to LinkedIn that they’re looking for work. The U.K.-based studio published King of Meat in October, backed by Amazon Game Studio. Insider Gaming reported that discussions around the layoffs began earlier in December, and that leadership previously told staff the studio “had the runway to keep going.”

Amazon Game Studios announced in 2021 that it was expanding its publishing efforts with Glowmade, which was working on an “exciting new IP.” Glowmade had 25 staffers, according to a news release at the time.

The studio’s leadership was reportedly hoping King of Meat would reach “a concurrent player count of at least 100,000,” but instead failed to maintain 1,000 players across platforms. On Steam, King of Meat had a recent 24-hour peak of 23 players; its top concurrent player number there is 320 players, according to SteamDB.

Most people probably only remember it as the game with the flashy trailer at Gamescom 2024 which featured an animated version of Opening Night Live host Geoff Keighley. That memorable moment could have cost close to half a million dollars, but apparently didn’t do much to keep King of Meat bubbling around in the popular consciousness.

King of Meat‘s October release didn’t go well despite a huge marketing push, including a big-budget MrBeast video. The video, which included a whole dang set, more than a dozen content creators, and a $250,000 prize, is essentially a mini-King of Meat esports event. It was published just after King of Meat‘s release date and racked up 6.8 million views.

Kotaku has reached out to Glowmade and Amazon Game Studios for comment.



https://kotaku.com/king-meat-glowmade-layoffs-keighley-mrbeast-trailer-2000651722

item.title: ‘Wholesome claw machine game’ Clawsome to be published by Whitethorn Games
item.content:encoded:
Whitethorn Games will publish Cometa Games-developed “wholesome claw machine game” Clawsome when it launches for PC via Steam in 2026, the companies announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Step into the whimsical world of Clawsome! Help Clawby find new friends in this wholesome claw machine game in which you collect unique and quirky prizes that move, disappear and even fight back! Navigate through ever changing challenges and build the most charming diorama collection with the figurines you grab!

Key Features

  • A Claw Machine Like No Other – Clawby isn’t your typical grabber. The world is alive with moving platforms, disappearing prizes, and unexpected twists that will keep you on your toes.
  • Collect Unique Figurines – Each prize you grab becomes part of your growing collection. View your treasures in beautifully crafted dioramas and examine them from different angles to appreciate every tiny little detail.
  • A Cozy and Wholesome Experience – With a playful art style and relaxing atmosphere, Clawsome will bring you joy whether you succeed or hilariously fail at grabbing a prize.
  • Charming Visuals and Delightful Soundtrack – Enjoy a colorful and vibrant world brought to life with expressive animations and a cozy soundtrack that makes every moment feel magical.

If you enjoy lighthearted challenges, charming collectibles, and a touch of mayhem, Clawsome is the perfect game for you with a mix of cozy vibes and unpredictable fun. Test your skills in the most delightful grabber game ever!

Each grab will bring you endless excitement!

Watch a new trailer below.

Publisher Announce Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/12/wholesome-claw-machine-game-clawsome-to-be-published-by-whitethorn-games

item.title: Star Wars: Unlimited TCG Booster Boxes Are Super Cheap At Amazon Right Now
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Star Wars: Unlimited Trading Card Game Booster Boxes and Starter Sets are on sale for extremely low prices at Amazon. Three Booster Boxes are available for over 50% off, including Legends of the Force, Jump to Lightspeed, and Twilight of the Republic. If you're interested in playing Asmodee's Star Wars TCG for the first time, the Starter Sets come with two ready-to-play decks and all of the accessories you need to dive in. Twilight of the Republic's Starter Set is discounted to only $18.80 (was $35), and Shadows of the Galaxy's Starter Set is $21.17 (was $35).

Along with the deals, Star Wars: Unlimited collectors can pick up the 2025 Gift Box for $30 at Amazon. The Gift Box comes with three exclusive cards and eight Booster Packs, which makes it a nice option for existing players and collectors as well as newcomers.

Star Wars: Unlimited - Booster Box Deals

Star Wars: Unlimited Booster Boxes include 24 packs with 16 cards each (384 cards total). The Legend of the Force Booster Box is the cheapest at $52.20 (was $120). With Amazon's deal price, you're only paying $2.17 per Booster Pack. Twilight of the Republic and Jump to Lightspeed are also discounted below $60. Amazon also has a deal on the Booster Box for Secrets of Power, the new Star Wars: Unlimited set that launched in November.

  • Legends of the Force (24 Packs) -- $52.20 ($120)
  • Twilight of the Republic (24 Packs) -- $54 ($120)
  • Jump to Lightspeed (24 Packs) -- $58.12 ($120)
  • Secrets of Power (24 Packs) -- $88 ($120)
  • Shadows of the Galaxy (24 Packs) -- $85.67 ($120)
  • Spark of Rebellion (24 Packs) -- $84.45 ($120)

Star Wars: Unlimited - Starter Sets & Spotlight Decks

The Starter Sets come with two 50-card decks, themed deck boxes, damage counters, and a quickstart guide. Each set includes one deck themed around the Rebellion and one for the Galactic Empire. The Twilight of the Republic Starter Set is led by Ahsoka and General Grievous, while Shadows of the Galaxy features The Mandalorian and Moff Gideon.

Asmodee stopped making Starter Sets after Twilight of the Republic. The last three sets have included two $25 Spotlight Decks instead. You can save on Legends of the Force and Jump to Lightspeed Spotlight Decks at Amazon. The Boba Fett Spotlight Deck is the cheapest at $18.87. In addition to the 50-card deck, each Spotlight Deck comes with a booster pack.

  • Twilight of the Republic Starter Set (2 Decks) -- $18.80 ($35)
  • Shadows of the Galaxy Starter Set (2 Decks) -- $21.17 ($35)
  • Legends of the Force Spotlight Decks
    • Darth Maul -- $21.74 ($25)
    • Qui-Gon Jinn -- $20.63 ($25)
  • Jump to Lightspeed Spotlight Decks
    • Han Solo -- $21 ($25)
    • Boba Fett -- $18.87 ($25)
  • Secrets of Power Spotlight Decks
    • Chancellor Palpatine -- $25
    • Padme Amidala -- $25

Star Wars: Unlimited TCG - 2025 Gift Box

$30

The first Star Wars: Unlimited Gift Box is basically a sampler platter, as it includes cards from four different sets. You'll get eight Star Wars: Unlimited Booster Packs, two exclusive variant cards, and one oversized leader card.

  • 2 Twilight of the Republic Booster Packs
  • 2 Jump to Lightspeed Booster Packs
  • 2 Legends of the Force Booster Packs
  • 2 Secrets of Power Booster Packs
  • Exclusive Obi-wan Kenobi Card
  • Exclusive Darth Sidious Card
  • Oversized Qui-Go Jinn Card

Browse Star Wars: Unlimited TCG by category:

For more Star Wars: Unlimited deals, check out the Amazon store pages we created based on category. Amazon has deals on several prerelease boxes right now. New players should also check out the recently released Intro Battle Hoth game for $20. Similar to Pokemon Battle Academy, Intro Battle Hoth is essentially a board game version of Star Wars: Unlimited.

item.title: PlayStation 2025 Wrap-Up: See How Much You Played This Year
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Yearly wraps have become an annual tradition across various platforms, and PlayStation is no exception. The PlayStation Wrap website has gone live, and once again, members of the PlayStation community can explore the total number of hours spent across single-player and multiplayer games. You'll have until January 8 to check out your stats--PlayStation Wrap-Up will continue to update until then--and users can redeem a unique glass-themed avatar once they complete their tour down memory lane.

This year's PlayStation Wrap-Up also includes a look at the number of games played on PS5 and PS4, a closer look at your gaming style, and even the DualSense controller you used the most. If you've used other PlayStation accessories, such as PlayStation VR2 or the PlayStation Portal handheld, those stats will also be included in your personal wrap-up. Additionally, you can get a brief look at how active you were on PlayStation Plus throughout the year, and Sony is also offering a curated list of recommended games to try out through the subscription service, if you're a member of the Premium or Extra tiers.

Ghost of Yotei, Death Stranding 2: On the Beach, Blue Prince, and Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 were considerable timesinks, while other noteworthy releases included games like Ball x Pit, Elden Ring Nightreign, and Battlefield 6 kept players glued to their screens for many hours.

What will the 2026 edition of PlayStation Wrap-Up look like? While things can still change, some of the big upcoming releases include Resident Evil Requiem, 007: First Light, and Yakuza Kiwami 3. Of course, if it doesn't suffer another delay, we expect the November 2026 release of Grand Theft Auto 6 to rank high on next year's list of the top five most-played games.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/playstation-2025-wrap-up-see-how-much-you-played-this-year/1100-6536799/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f
